ENSURE COMPLETE AND USABLE DEPOSITS

Technical Verification

Learn how software escrow verification lets you ensure you have everything you need to redeploy your business applications and other critical assets.

GET STARTED

Secure your code, data, and peace of mind

Deposit

Escrow deposits sometimes contain files that are corrupted, incomplete, difficult to use, or even contain viruses. Documentation could be missing, passwords could be improperly documented, third-party dependencies not outlined or included, etc

Verify

Different levels of technical verification are used to validate the completeness, accuracy, and usability of materials deposited into escrow as assurance that the beneficiary will be able to effectively deploy their escrow deposit in case of a release.

Release

Verification provides an additional layer of protection and peace of mind by ensuring the beneficiary has everything they need for a successful recovery — whether they’re using their developer’s source code in-house or transitioning to a new supplier.

Codekeeper verification solutions

We offer four levels of verification to ensure that all parties to an escrow agreement get the level of protection they need. The level that’s right for you depends on your budget, risk tolerance, and degree of customization.

Need verification services outside of our standard offering?
Send us your requirements, and we will design a bespoke verification process that meets your needs.

Verification Micro

Our micro verification option includes an escrow content inspection report, including source code and any other data. This option also includes a review of development activity on the source code, and it’s a good starting point for companies that are simply looking to ensure that materials deposited in escrow are complete and up-to-date.

Verification Basic

Our basic verification option gives you a thorough code inspection, including source code, configuration materials, and other supporting documentation. This option is great for companies that want to validate the completeness and accuracy of escrowed materials to ensure they have everything they need to update the software application, without assistance from the licensor.

Verification Advanced

Our advanced verification option includes all the features of basic verification, in addition to installing your software application and running an operational version of the software. Companies for which it is imperative to ensure continuity in case of a release event often pick this option to validate not only the completeness and accuracy of materials deposited in escrow but also that the application runs as expected.

Verification Complete

Our complete verification option includes all advanced verification features, plus testing up to 20 key features* of your software. Though the goal here is not to conduct a full acceptance test of the software, this option is great for companies that want to minimize the chance of disruption to or delay in business operations by detecting any potential issues preemptively. It ensures that the beneficiary can redeploy the application without delay and thus avoid any ramifications of losing access to mission-critical software.

*A feature can be anything contained in the source code. General examples of what this can mean: the application sends an email confirmation; application has a working email signup process; the user is able to upload a file; and others.*
